quizzes.question: What type of editor is used to edit HTML code?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The HTML File[/h1]

HTML files are text files, so you can use any [b]text editor[/b] to create your first webpage. 
There are some very nice HTML editors available; you can choose the one that works for you. For now let's write our examples in [b]Notepad[/b]. [img id="2466" width="100%"]
[note]You can run, save, and share your HTML codes on our [b]Code Playground[/b], without installing any additional software.[/note]

quizzes.question: What is the correct extension for HTML files?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The HTML File[/h1]

Add the basic HTML structure to the text editor with "This is a line of text" in the body section. [code format="html" codeId="5"]<html>
   <head>
   </head>
   <body>
[b]      This is a line of text. [/b]
   </body>
</html>[/code]
[note]Donâ€™t forget to save the file. HTML file names should end in either [b].html[/b] or [b].htm[/b][/note]
In our example, the file is saved as [b]first.html[/b] 

When the file is opened, the following result is displayed in the web browser: [img id="2527" width="100%"]

quizzes.question: Where should you put the title tag?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The <title> Tag[/h1]

To place a title on the tab describing the web page, add a <title> element to your head section: [code format="html" codeId="6"]<html>
   <head>[b]
      <title>[/b]first page[b]</title>
[/b]   </head>
   <body>
      This is a line of text. 
   </body>[b]
[/b]</html>[/code]
This will produce the following result: [img id="2528" width="100%"]
[note]The title element is important because it describes the page and is used by search engines.[/note]
